page.title: 11Housing Cheshire Home Penn
page.content: Leonard Cheshire was the founder of all the Cheshire homes. The first home was opened in 1966 in Hampshire and it was called Le Court. A Cheshire Home is a place where physically handicapped adults are cared for. In the UK there are 75 homes and 140 in 47 countries. There are 5000 people cared for in Cheshire Homes world wide. The red feather is the symbol of the Cheshire Foundation. All Cheshire Homes have this symbol. At St. Anthony's there are 40 disabled people, both married and single, who get around in wheelchairs either manual or electric. To go shopping or go on outings they have 4 ambulances. Some of the money which runs the Home comes from charity, some from local government but most from fund raising events such as garden fetes held at the Home.
